Deneice: Since when did you start making house calls?

Deneice: How rich is she?

Chris: Nice thought, but, actually, I'm just restocking my bag. I like to

Kevin: Ok, here we are and in full regalia. So now what? Skunk?
Lucy: No, nothing that earthly.

Kevin: Hold it. If you're suggesting what happened to Jack and to Victor's

Lucy: No, Doc, but we can't rule out anything.
Kevin: Oh, that's it. I'm out of here.

Kevin: Well, at least we agree on that.

Kevin: Right. Whatever it was turned Abe into a madman.

Kevin: Lucy, the police have been all over these woods.

Lucy: I know, Doc, but it's something that those conventional kind of methods

Livvie: God. I won't let him get to me. I won't.

Ian: You won't marry us?

Michael: I can't lie to you two. I can't marry you because of my brother. I

Kevin: So, this is, what, witchcraft?

Kevin: Where the evil spirits lurk?

Lucy: Right. Well, I think the stranger, the evil spirit, is somehow lurking

Kevin: That's the simplified version?

Lucy: Ok. Ok. Ok.

Jack: Ok. Well, no worries. I'll be ok.

Jack: What do you want?

Chris: We are brothers.

Livvie: Thanks for coming.

Alison: But you are in love with Jack.

Ian: There's nothing we can do to change your mind?

Jack: You're walking now.
Chris: Are you afraid to figure out what's wrong with you?

Chris: You're sick, Jack. You're spiking a fever, yet you still have the

Jack: There's your explanation.

Chris: Wait. That biker girl -- Sam? She told me about your little run-in

Jack: Oh, I need a reason for that, too, Chris?
Chris: You know something's happening to you, and everybody can see it.
Jack: Even if there was, why would I go to you for help?
Chris: Because I'm your best bet about now.
Jack: What's in it for you?
Chris: Money. A lot of money. And before you say anything -- I'll cut you in.
Jack: I'm not interested.

Chris: All right, fair enough. Don't want to do it for money -- I respect

Jack: What about her?

Chris: You're out of control, little brother. What happens if, next time, you

Jack: I won't.
